SEARCH
Package pt.ipp.isep.dei.g312.repository

Class EmployeeRepository

java.lang.Object
pt.ipp.isep.dei.g312.repository.EmployeeRepository
public class EmployeeRepository extends Object
This class represents a repository for managing Employee objects. It provides methods for adding, retrieving, updating, and searching for employees.

  • Constructor Details

    • EmployeeRepository

      public EmployeeRepository()

  • Method Details

    • getEmployees

      public Optional<Employee> getEmployees(String taxpayerNumber)
      Retrieves an `Optional` containing the employee with the specified taxpayer number. If no employee is found, an empty `Optional` is returned.
      Parameters:
      taxpayerNumber - The taxpayer number of the employee to search for.
      Returns:
      An `Optional` containing the employee or empty if not found.

    • getEmployees

      public List<Employee> getEmployees()
      Returns a copy of the list containing all registered employees. Modifying the returned list will not affect the internal employee list.
      Returns:
      A copy of the employee list.

    • addEmployee

      public Optional<Employee> addEmployee(Employee employee)
      Attempts to add a new employee to the repository.
      Parameters:
      employee - The employee object to be added.
      Returns:
      An `Optional` containing the added employee if successful, or empty if the operation fails

    • validateEmployee

      public boolean validateEmployee(Employee employee)
      Validates if the provided employee can be added to the repository. Currently, it checks for duplicate employees based on object equality.
      Parameters:
      employee - The employee to be validated.
      Returns:
      True if the employee is valid to add, false otherwise.

    • printRegisteredEmployees

      public void printRegisteredEmployees()
      Prints information about all registered employees, including their names and jobs.

    • printRegisteredEmployeesAndHisSkills

      public void printRegisteredEmployeesAndHisSkills()
      Prints a formatted list of all registered employees and their associated skills. If the employee has no skills, "No skills assigned" is displayed. Otherwise, a comma-separated list of the employee's skill names is printed.

    • addSkillsToCollaboratorProfile

      public Optional<Employee> addSkillsToCollaboratorProfile(Employee collaborator, List<Skill> skillsToAdd)
      Attempts to add a list of skills to an existing employee's profile by finding the employee in the repository and then updates their skills
      Parameters:
      collaborator - The employee object whose skills should be updated.
      skillsToAdd - The list of skills to be added to the employee's profile.
      Returns:
      An `Optional` containing the updated employee if successful, or empty if the collaborator is not found.

    • findEmployee

      public Optional<Employee> findEmployee(Employee collaborator)
      Method to find an employee by any attribute. Currently, it searches based on object equality with the provided string.
      Parameters:
      collaborator - A string representing the employee attribute to search for.
      Returns:
      An `Optional` containing the employee if found, or empty if not found.

    • getEmployFromJob

      public Employee getEmployFromJob(String rl)
      Deprecated.
      This method does not use `Optional` for null safety. Consider using `findEmployee` with a search criteria based on job title instead.
      This method iterates through the employee list and searches for an employee whose job title matches the provided string. If a match is found, the employee object is returned. Otherwise, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      rl - The job title of the employee to search for.
      Returns:
      The employee object with the matching job title, or null if not found.

    • getEmployeeSkills

      public List<Skill> getEmployeeSkills(Employee employee)
      Retrieves a copy of the list containing the employee's associated skills..
      Parameters:
      employee - The employee whose skills should be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A copy of the employee's skill list.

    • getEmployeeSortedByNumberOfSkill

      public List<Employee> getEmployeeSortedByNumberOfSkill()
